content: Barack Obama is a former President of the United States who served two terms in office from 2009 to 2017. As of September 2021, he is 61 years old. He was born on August 4, 1961, in Honolulu, Hawaii, and grew up in the state before attending college on the mainland. Obama later attended Harvard Law School and served as a community organizer, state senator, and U.S. senator before being elected as President in 2008. During his time in office, Obama implemented a number of significant policy changes, including the Affordable Care Act and the legalization of same-sex marriage, and he played a key role in international relations, particularly in the Middle East. After leaving office, Obama has continued to be active in politics and public life, and has remained a influential figure in the Democratic Party.
